ComicInfo.Title: A Sculpture's Studio; Cracked Interviews the Technical School King; The Pond; The Silly Cosbey Show; If Television Censors Had Their Way; Expanding the Use of Picture Signs; What's Good... and Not So Good about Bigfoot; VCR Home Movie Accessories Catalog; The True Meaning of Art; Wishful Thinking; Magazines That Tried to Copy Cracked, But Failed (Thank Goodness); Kids, Toys, and Future Careers; Your Moneys' Worth; Simpe & Simple
ComicInfo.Summary:
British editions are identical to the US editions except for the price and cover date. The UK numbering includes Cracked Collectors' Editions.A sculptor has to endure constant criticism from his model.
Cracked visits a technical school which teaches important trades such as ice cream cone engineering.
A frog catches the lure on a flyfisher's rod.
How censorship would force changes on football, game shows, the news, western programs and nature programs.
Picture signs for politics, occupations, benign things, the beach and sports.
A mock catalog for accessories to make one's home theatre more like the cinema.
A man is sent to jail for singing but turns a musical note into the key.
People wish for better outcomes than their present situation.
Mock features from Cracked's supposed imitators: Nuts, Apples, Fool and Crackeder.
How children's toys seem to predict their future careers.
A video arcade machine which simulates driving suddenly takes off like a car.
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev36 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-04-05 17:39:03. [Issue ID 250573]
ComicInfo.Penciller: Walt Lardner,Don Orehek,Bob Taylor,John Severin,John Langton,Warren Sattler,Rurik Tyler
ComicInfo.Inker: Walt Lardner,Don Orehek,Bob Taylor,John Severin,John Langton,Warren Sattler,Rurik Tyler
